definition: variant of 確|确[que4]/variant of 埆[que4]
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
role (theater)/to compete/ancient three legged wine vessel/third note of pentatonic scale
angle/corner/horn/horn-shaped/unit of money equal to 0.1 yuan, or 10 cents (a dime)/CL:個|个[ge4]
definite/certain/fixed/to fix (on sth)/to determine/to be sure/to ensure/to make certain/to ascertain/to clinch/to recognize/to confirm/OK (on computer dialog box)
to make a definite diagnosis/confirmed (case of a specific disease)
to be convinced/to be sure/to firmly believe/to be positive that/definite news

sentences.english: I would like to receive from you a detailed report on current market conditions every month .
sentences.chinese: 我想每月收到你方一份具体确当前市场行情报告。

sentences.english: Nor is there anything new in wearing leather itself.
sentences.chinese: 但皮革本身确没什么新穿法。

sentences.english: The first six months after my diagnosis my life just stopped.
sentences.chinese: 确断后的前六个月我的生命好像停止了。

sentences.english: It's worth realising that most of us do already eat insects.
sentences.chinese: 值得一提的是，我们大多数人都确已吃过昆虫。

sentences.english: I＇m confident you＇ve made the right choice.
sentences.chinese: 我相信你已经作了正点确的选择。

sentences.english: The Hindus did produce some primitive mathematics.
sentences.chinese: 印度人确也创造出一些原始数学。

sentences.english: That emergency was now on them and the generalissimo , himself, flew to Manchuria.
sentences.chinese: 现在局势确很危急，蒋介石亲自飞来满洲督战。

sentences.english: A disease&n bsp;known is half cured.
sentences.chinese: 病情确诊断，治病好一半。

sentences.english: The U. S. military ststyleed Desert Shield with very poor maps of the region.
sentences.chinese: 美军初阶沙漠盾牌行动时行使确本地舆图很差。

sentences.english: But instead, Cupid fell deeply in love with her.
sentences.chinese: 但是，丘比特确深深爱上了普赛克，并娶她为妻。

sentences.english: The U. S. military stcrafted Desert Shield with very poor maps of the region.
sentences.chinese: 美军起首沙漠盾牌行动时运用确本地舆图很差。

sentences.english: Although she is a successful career woman, she never puts on airs.
sentences.chinese: 虽然她是个事有成的职业妇女，确从不摆架子。

sentences.english: All the prices in the lists get subject to our finis confirmine.
sentences.chinese: 单上所有价值以我方末端确觉得准。

sentences.english: He did misappropriate the public funds, but there were extenuating circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 确挪用了公款，但有可以减轻罪责的情况。

definition: to allow/to grant/in accordance with/in the light of
to cut into/to incise/to penetrate deeply into (a topic, area etc)/cut (offensive moves in basketball)
